title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 13-for-19 shooting, leading the Celtics to a close 109-108 win over the 76ers.
Celtics improved their record to .500 and are 1-0 in NBA Cup Group B play after their third straight victory.
Both teams tied with 56 rebounds, but the Celtics outperformed in offensive boards, securing 16 against the Sixers' 9.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodstained Jackie Kennedy costume for Halloween, calling it a statement, not just a costume.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's costume as 'disgusting' and 'dangerous', implying it glorifies political violence.
Fox defended the costume, citing Jackie Kennedy's act of not changing clothes after JFK's assassination as profound symbolism.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London, both recovering from injuries, are set to play against the Patriots.
London, ranked sixth among wide receivers by Pro Football Focus, has 38 catches, 20 first downs, and averages 78.2 yards per game.
The 6-2 Patriots, on a five-game winning streak, face a 3-4 Falcons team that recently lost two consecutive games.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players after making the playoffs in 2025.
Key players like Alex Bregman may opt out, leading to potential gaps at third base, shortstop, and top pitching spots.
The Red Sox have $25 million before the luxury tax threshold and a strong farm system to improve their roster.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses notion that Patriots changes aim to separate from the team's successful past.
Patriots introduced offensive starters individually in Week 8, ending a 24-year team introduction tradition.
Vrabel's Patriots lead AFC East with 6-2 record, despite adjustments, highlighting changes at halfway mark.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks for the Bruins due to a lower-body injury from a collision against Buffalo.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to the Bruins' top line center, joining David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm had four goals and nine points this season, all power-play contributions, before his injury.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in full costume flood Salem, Massachusetts, on Halloween, the city's busiest day, enhancing the town's spooky festivities.
Salem's Essex Street is bustling with street performers, markets, and vibrant Halloween decorations enjoyed by residents and visitors.
Halloween attractions include the Witch Trials Memorial, where tourists leave flowers and trinkets to honor the victims.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused Donald Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein in a TV interview without providing evidence.
Moulton's claims were made during a conversation with MSNBC host Joe Scarborough, who questioned the lack of evidence.
Scarborough countered Moulton's accusations, stressing the need for evidence while discussing issues surrounding Donald Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial jury selection scheduled for Nov. 18, expected to last two weeks.
Judge orders preservation of cellphone evidence from former State Trooper Michael Proctor for Walshe's defense.
Cellphone contained sensitive information, with defense seeking more documents before potential destruction.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market in Newton reopened three days after closing for a potential asbestos issue in a stockroom.
MassDEP confirmed the asbestos was contained, and air samples in the store showed no contamination risk to the public.
Asbestos abatement will continue in a sealed stockroom, ensuring no danger to shoppers or staff.
